title: Can we take Athenes off the recommended build for offensive mages?
body: Putting Athenes on the recommended build for Syndra, Xerath, and assorted other mid lane mages is misleading and really should be taken off. I've had many games where the mid laner builds it because the recommended build says so even though the item doesn't really help them at all. Please remove it from the champions it doesn't benefit and leave it on the ones it does.

They changed Athene's because the old Morellonomicon and Athene's were 2 variations of an item that served the exact same function for most champions. It's kinda hypocritical considering how they did Zeal items during the Marksman rework, but it was still their reasoning.

Nothing about that is hypocritical, all the seal items serve distinct different purposes and each of them is bought regularly, while between old Grail and Morellonomicron Morellos was literally the ebst choice in 99% of all cases, so it was totally sensical to remove Grail as an AP item.

Statistically the items are almost the same. The passives create a little variation, but they're hardly more distinct from one another than Athene's and Morello's were. Also 99% is a huge exaggeration, Morrelo's was the better choice about 60-70% of the time, but Athene's gave even more mana regen and a little bit of magic resist. Plus Chalice was a much better mana sustain item early on than forbidden idol.

Each Zeal item serves a strategic niche, while the stats they give are the same/similar, their purposes are otherwise VERY different. Athene's and Morrelo's had a Defensive/Offensive thing going on, but rarely were they ever considered even in power. Most of the time, one was just flat better than the other, first Grail, then Morello's.

Current Zeal items each have a specific use case and win condition they are playing towards. Firecannon is Siege and Poke, Shiv is waveclear, and PD is Kite/Dueling. Morello/Grail was basically a choice between MR or more AP, and the choice more or less purely came down to which ever one was more gold efficient at the time.
Riot was sick of most AP mid players were either getting it or morello's, depending on which one was better that patch, so they ruined it on purpose.

{{item:3069}} {{item:2045}} {{item:3040}} {{item:3117}} {{item:3504}} {{item:3110}}  
I usually build something like this, with some minor adjustments depending on unique game needs.
It's not a damage build, so it's not suggested if the team is light on damage.
It's a hyper-supportive build, where you are more often moving the team around with E to outrotate the other team, and you use ult to make picks. Diminuendo in skirmishes is also absurdly powerful.

It's more of a playstyle difference, where you play more enchantress and protection than bursty-poke.
